course.title: Faith and Authenticity: Religion, Existentialism and the Human Condition
course.description: What is an authentic individual life? How does one find meaning in light of modern challenges to claims about the nature of God, revelation and the soul? Is religious faith compatible with an understanding of historicity and the threat of nihilism? This course introduces central questions in Western philosophy of religion through close reading of fundamental texts in existentialism with some attention to their Christian theological sources. Reading and participatory discussion of text by Plato, Paul, Luther, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Dostoevsky, Sartre, de Beauvoir, Camus, Heidegger, Bultmann and Tillich.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Ethical Reasoning.
